text: It has been reported that CVB3 replication is promoted by cell cycle inhibitors which induce cell cycle arrest at G1/S phase (Feuer et al., 2002) . To confirm that the arrest of G1 phase facilitates CVB3 replication, HeLa cells were synchronized at G1 phase through the addition of thymidine and infected with CVB3 (MOI = 1) ( Figure 7A) . Compared with non-synchronized (Figures 7B-D) showed significantly increased level of CVB3 genome ( Figure 7E) . These data indicate that G1 arrest facilitates CVB3 replication.
